title: Are Billie Eilish concerts all ages? - Quora

response.answer_text: Her tour doesn’t set any limits on age. However, it really depends entirely on the venue/event. Some of her shows are definitely 18+ (some of the festivals are tailored to drinking age audiences). Her own shows (where she is the headliner) don’t usually have a set age limit. If you’re a parent wondering whether she is age appropriate for a kid, then it really depends on if you’re okay with a little swearing. If your kid is older than 10, then they’ve probably heard worse things sitting on the school bus.

I don’t think an age is set for her shows, especially her tour, but it depends on the discretion of the parents. Most of Billie’s songs are pretty clean when it comes to language, but when it comes to other things, there are definitely some songs that I consider more appropriate than others. She also has a slightly mature interlude in her concerts of the tour that was postponed due to covid-19. Personally, I think anywhere from 11-13 would be a good minimum age for a Billie concert, but it really depends! :)

18+ Her tour doesn't set any limits on age. However, it really depends entirely on the venue/event. Some of her shows are definitely 18+ (some of the festivals are tailored to drinking age audiences). Her own shows (where she is the headliner) don't usually have a set age limit.
I’m not sure that the child has turned 18 yet, so I would assume that any age could attend her concerts. Provided they were a really mature 5 year old.
Well some young people are there. But I think it's 14+. For the standing area a person who is 14+ should have a adult who is over17+
As long as your a bi-polar, depressed, suicidal cutter with ADH (or whatever) you'll be fine.
Yes, but you have to be ok with some swearing They don’t have anything up about how old you should be
